unnormalised: **Quora Post: Exam Prep Apps - Are they actually helpful, ya?**
normalised: **Quora Post: Exam Prep Apps - Are they actually helpful, yeah?**

unnormalised: Okay guys, so I'm prepping for my AIIMS entrance exam (wish me luck!) and drowning in books is, like, so 2000-and-late. Everyone keeps telling me "use exam prep apps, use exam prep apps!" But honestly, are they *really* helpful or just another distraction tempting me to procrastinate?
normalised: Okay guys, so I'm prepping for my A I I M S entrance exam (wish me luck!) and drowning in books is, like, so two thousand and late. Everyone keeps telling me "use exam prep apps, use exam prep apps!" But honestly, are they *really* helpful or just another distraction tempting me to procrastinate?

unnormalised: I've tried a few. Some are legit good. Like, the mock tests on some apps actually felt kinda similar to what my seniors at IIT Delhi were describing. Helps to get a feel for the time pressure, right? Especially when you've got a 180-minute deadline breathing down your neck.
normalised: I've tried a few. Some are legit good. Like, the mock tests on some apps actually felt kinda similar to what my seniors at I I T Delhi were describing. Helps to get a feel for the time pressure, right? Especially when you've got a one hundred and eighty minute deadline breathing down your neck.

unnormalised: But then others are just… meh. Too many ads, the questions are outdated (feels like they're still prepping for the 2010 syllabus!), and the explanations make zero sense. I even found one that had a question referencing the 1998 Pokhran tests! Dude, seriously?
normalised: But then others are just… meh. Too many ads, the questions are outdated (feels like they're still prepping for the two thousand and ten syllabus!), and the explanations make zero sense. I even found one that had a question referencing the one thousand nine hundred and ninety eight Pokhran tests! Dude, seriously?

unnormalised: Anyone have any recommendations for apps that are actually useful for competitive exams like JEE or NEET? Specifically, something that updates their content regularly, has good analytics so I can track my progress, and doesn't cost an arm and a leg (this student is broke, ya know!). And ideally, something that allows me to study offline when I'm traveling from my village near Varanasi to coaching class at 06:00 hrs on 26/01/2024.
normalised: Anyone have any recommendations for apps that are actually useful for competitive exams like J E E or N E E T? Specifically, something that updates their content regularly, has good analytics so I can track my progress, and doesn't cost an arm and a leg (this student is broke, yeah know!). And ideally, something that allows me to study offline when I'm traveling from my village near Varanasi to coaching class at six o'clock on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Also, side question: does anyone know if the "Motivational Guru" recordings some apps offer are actually helpful or just a waste of bandwidth? Need to decide if I should invest my precious internet quota that I saved from 15/08/2023! Thanks in advance!
normalised: Also, side question: does anyone know if the "Motivational Guru" recordings some apps offer are actually helpful or just a waste of bandwidth? Need to decide if I should invest my precious internet quota that I saved from fifteenth august two thousand and twenty three! Thanks in advance!
